news_header: Severe wildfires in Los Angeles County are driven by high winds and dry conditions, forcing evacuations and causing fatalities.
news_text: Unusually dry conditions and hurricane-force winds are causing destructive wildfires in Los Angeles County, leading to over 100,000 evacuations and at least two fatalities. The Palisades fire has burned over 6,400 hectares and destroyed around 1,000 structures. Climate change is exacerbating these conditions, making wildfires more intense and frequent. Smoke from the fires poses health risks to millions, particularly vulnerable populations.
